availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Truitt (Greenup County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Truitt. Father of Mary E. Truitt, Clarissa Truitt, John S. Truitt, George W. Truitt, and James W. Truitt. Farmer in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Employed Joseph Gibson as a day laborer in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 228A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 726.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 3, p. 78B.
Find A Grave, "George W. Truitt (1829-1898)," Memorial #7348743, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7348743 (accessed April 21, 2020).
